nodes.title: Article 1
nodes.summary: The partial document defines key terms and institutional structures related to environmental and social assessment in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It establishes the "Groupe d'Etudes Environnementales du Congo" (GEEC) as the coordinating body and outlines the main procedural documents, including technical manuals, the Environmental Permit, Environmental and Social Impact Studies (EIES), Environmental and Social Management Plans (PGES and PGESO), the Environmental Attestation, and the Environmental Dashboard (TBE).

nodes.title: Article 10
nodes.summary:
This partial document outlines the transfer of assets, liabilities, and responsibilities from the environmental unit of the PMURR (and related projects) to the GEEC. The main points are:

1.  The complete assets and liabilities of the PMURR's environmental unit are automatically transferred to the GEEC.
2.  All commitments and agreements made by that unit with various partners and other government programs are also transferred to the GEEC.
3.  All assets acquired by the SOFRECO project for the PMURR's environmental and social assessment, along with all other PMURR outputs, documents, and intellectual property rights, are automatically transferred to the GEEC's assets.

nodes.title: Article 2
nodes.summary:
This partial document covers Article 2 of an official decree from the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Its main points are:
1. The creation, organization, and functioning of the GEEC (Environmental and Social Evaluation Committee), a technical government body.
2. The GEEC's mandate to conduct and coordinate all activities related to Environmental and Social Evaluation (EIA).
3. A listing of the GEEC's specific missions, which include defining the EIA process, ensuring compliance with environmental and social norms in development projects, promoting capacity building, fostering public consultation and training, and presenting an annual environmental dashboard.
4. A detailed outline of the GEEC's purposes, which include contributing to good environmental governance, strengthening institutional capacities, ensuring transparency among stakeholders, acting as an evaluator to prevent negative impacts, and collecting environmental data across the country.

nodes.title: Article 3
nodes.summary:
This partial document is an official decree (Arrêté) that transfers the responsibilities for environmental and social evaluation of the PMURR project. The main points covered are:

1.  The contract with the external firm SOFRECO for this evaluation is ending on February 7, 2007.
2.  The responsibility for conducting the PMURR's environmental and social evaluation is formally transferred from the project's "cellule environnement" to the GEEC (likely a government or internal unit).
3.  The GEEC is now the designated contact point for the project's steering committee and executing agencies on these matters.
4.  The decree allows the GEEC to arrange special collaborations with external national or international experts if needed to finalize specific projects requiring specialized environmental management expertise.

nodes.title: Article 5
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the appointment and recruitment procedures for the management and staff of the GEEC (likely a government environmental agency or body). It specifies that the Director General and Deputy Director General are appointed by ministerial decree for renewable five-year terms. The recruitment of senior staff is to be conducted competitively by an independent consultant, with final selections approved by the Minister. Current staff from an existing environmental unit are automatically transferred, while the recruitment of other staff is managed by the Director General according to internal regulations.

nodes.title: Article 6
nodes.summary:
This partial document covers Article 6 of a regulation, outlining the mission and tasks of the General Directorate of GEEC (likely an environmental and social evaluation body) in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The main points are the core duties of the General Director and the delegated tasks of GEEC's managerial staff.

The specific duties include:
*   Conducting and coordinating environmental and social evaluations for all investment projects.
*   Recommending measures to mitigate negative impacts and enhance positive ones.
*   Developing sector-specific evaluation methodologies.
*   Updating technical procedure manuals.
*   Contributing to capacity building for public administration and investors.
*   Managing GEEC's administrative, financial, and legal affairs.
*   Finalizing environmental framework laws and developing implementing measures.
*   The possibility of hiring national and international experts under specific conditions.

For GEEC's managers, their delegated tasks involve:
*   Conducting the evaluations.
*   Ensuring proper execution of procedures as defined in technical and administrative manuals.
*   Ensuring capacity building for public and private investors.
